content: 1 Whereas in many parts and in many ways of old God spake unto the fathers in the prophets
content_old: 1 Whereas in many parts and in many ways of old God spake unto the fathers in the prophets

content: 2 At the end of these days He hath spoken unto us in his Son,— Whom he hath appointed heir of all things, Through whom also he hath made the ages;
content_old: 2 At the end of these days He hath spoken unto us in his Son,— Whom he hath appointed heir of all things, Through whom also he hath made the ages;

content: 3 Who being an eradiated brightness of his glory､ And an exact representation of his very being, Also bearing up all things by the utterance of his power, Purification of sins having achieved Sat down on the right hand of the majesty in high places:
content_old: 3 Who being an eradiated brightness of his glory､ And an exact representation of his very being, Also bearing up all things by the utterance of his power, Purification of sins having achieved Sat down on the right hand of the majesty in high places:

content: 4 By so much becoming superior to the messengers､ By as much as､ going beyond them､ he hath inherited a more distinguished name.
content_old: 4 By so much becoming superior to the messengers､ By as much as､ going beyond them､ he hath inherited a more distinguished name.

content: 5 For unto which of the messengers said he at any time— My Son art thou, I this day have begotten thee? and again— I will become his father, And he shall become my Son?
content_old: 5 For unto which of the messengers said he at any time— My Son art thou, I this day have begotten thee? and again— I will become his father, And he shall become my Son?

content: 6 But whensoever he again introduceth the first-begotten into the habitable earth he saith— And let all God’s messengers worship him!
content_old: 6 But whensoever he again introduceth the first-begotten into the habitable earth he saith— And let all God’s messengers worship him!

content: 7 Even as to the messengers indeed､ he saith— Who maketh his messengers winds And his ministers of state a fiery flame;
content_old: 7 Even as to the messengers indeed､ he saith— Who maketh his messengers winds And his ministers of state a fiery flame;

content: 8 but as to the Son— Thy throne､ O God､ is unto times age-abiding, and— A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of his kingdom,
content_old: 8 but as to the Son— Thy throne､ O God､ is unto times age-abiding, and— A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of his kingdom,

content: 9 Thou hast loved righteousness､ and hated lawlessness,— For this cause hath God､ thy God､ anointed thee with the oil of exultation beyond thy partners;
content_old: 9 Thou hast loved righteousness､ and hated lawlessness,— For this cause hath God､ thy God､ anointed thee with the oil of exultation beyond thy partners;

content: 10 and— Thou by way of beginning Lord､ the earth didst found, And the works of thy hands are the heavens,—
content_old: 10 and— Thou by way of beginning Lord､ the earth didst found, And the works of thy hands are the heavens,—

content: 11 They shall perish､ But thou abidest still, And all as a mantle shall be worn out,
content_old: 11 They shall perish､ But thou abidest still, And all as a mantle shall be worn out,

content: 12 And as if a robe wilt thou fold them up,— As a mantle, and they shall be changed; But thou art the same, And thy years shall not fail
content_old: 12 And as if a robe wilt thou fold them up,— As a mantle, and they shall be changed; But thou art the same, And thy years shall not fail

content: 13 But to which of the messengers hath he said､ at any time— Sit thou at my right hand, Until I make thy foes thy footstool?
content_old: 13 But to which of the messengers hath he said､ at any time— Sit thou at my right hand, Until I make thy foes thy footstool?

content: 1 For this cause it behoveth us with unwonted firmness to be holding fast unto the things that have been heard, lest､ at any time､ we drift away.
content_old: 1 For this cause it behoveth us with unwonted firmness to be holding fast unto the things that have been heard, lest､ at any time､ we drift away.

content: 2 For if the word through messengers spoken became firm､ and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense
content_old: 2 For if the word through messengers spoken became firm､ and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense

content: 3 how shall we escape, if so great a salvation as this we have neglected,—which indeed､ having received a beginning of being spoken through the Lord by them who heard unto us was confirmed,
content_old: 3 how shall we escape, if so great a salvation as this we have neglected,—which indeed､ having received a beginning of being spoken through the Lord by them who heard unto us was confirmed,

content: 4 God jointly witnessing also both with signs and wonders and manifold mighty works､ and with distributions of Holy Spirit according to his own will?
content_old: 4 God jointly witnessing also both with signs and wonders and manifold mighty works､ and with distributions of Holy Spirit according to his own will?

content: 5 For not unto messengers hath he subjected the coming habitable earth of which we are speaking;
content_old: 5 For not unto messengers hath he subjected the coming habitable earth of which we are speaking;

content: 6 But one somewhere hath borne witness, saying— What is man､ that thou shouldst make mention of him? Or the son of man､ that thou shouldst put him in charge?
content_old: 6 But one somewhere hath borne witness, saying— What is man､ that thou shouldst make mention of him? Or the son of man､ that thou shouldst put him in charge?

content: 7 Thou hast made him less､ some little､ than messengers, With glory and honour hast thou crowned him,— And hast set him over the works of thy hands;
content_old: 7 Thou hast made him less､ some little､ than messengers, With glory and honour hast thou crowned him,— And hast set him over the works of thy hands;

content: 8 All things hast thou subjected beneath his feet. For in subjecting､ to him the all things Nothing left he､ to him unsubjected; But now､ not yet do we see､ to him､ the all things subjected;—
content_old: 8 All things hast thou subjected beneath his feet. For in subjecting､ to him the all things Nothing left he､ to him unsubjected; But now､ not yet do we see､ to him､ the all things subjected;—

content: 9 But Jesus, made some little less than messengers we do behold: By reason of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honour, To the end that､ by favour of God､ in behalf of every one he might taste of death.
content_old: 9 But Jesus, made some little less than messengers we do behold: By reason of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honour, To the end that､ by favour of God､ in behalf of every one he might taste of death.

content: 10 For it was becoming in him— For the sake of whom are the all things､ And by means of whom are the all things,— When many sons unto glory he would lead, The Princely Leader of their salvation through sufferings to make perfect.
content_old: 10 For it was becoming in him— For the sake of whom are the all things､ And by means of whom are the all things,— When many sons unto glory he would lead, The Princely Leader of their salvation through sufferings to make perfect.

content: 11 For both he that maketh holy､ and they who are being made holy Are all of One; For which cause he is not ashamed to be calling them brethren,
content_old: 11 For both he that maketh holy､ and they who are being made holy Are all of One; For which cause he is not ashamed to be calling them brethren,

content: 12 saying— I will declare thy name unto my brethren, In the midst of an assembly will I sing praise unto thee;
content_old: 12 saying— I will declare thy name unto my brethren, In the midst of an assembly will I sing praise unto thee;

content: 13 and again— I will be confident upon him; and again— Lo! I and the children which､ unto me､ God hath given.
content_old: 13 and again— I will be confident upon him; and again— Lo! I and the children which､ unto me､ God hath given.

content: 14 Seeing therefore the children have received a fellowship of blood and flesh He also in like manner took partnership in the same,— In order that through death— He might paralyse him that held the dominion of death, That is､ the Adversary,—
content_old: 14 Seeing therefore the children have received a fellowship of blood and flesh He also in like manner took partnership in the same,— In order that through death— He might paralyse him that held the dominion of death, That is､ the Adversary,—

content: 15 And might release these— As many as by fear of death were all their lifetime liable to bondage.
content_old: 15 And might release these— As many as by fear of death were all their lifetime liable to bondage.

content: 16 For not surely of messengers is he laying hold, But of Abraham’s seed he is laying hold.
content_old: 16 For not surely of messengers is he laying hold, But of Abraham’s seed he is laying hold.

content: 17 Whence he was obliged in every way unto the brethren to be made like, That he might become a merciful and faithful high-priest､ In the things pertaining unto God,— For the making of propitiation for the sins of the people.
content_old: 17 Whence he was obliged in every way unto the brethren to be made like, That he might become a merciful and faithful high-priest､ In the things pertaining unto God,— For the making of propitiation for the sins of the people.

content: 1 Whence､ holy brethren､ partners in a heavenly calling, Attentively consider the Apostle and High-priest of our confession—Jesus
content_old: 1 Whence､ holy brethren､ partners in a heavenly calling, Attentively consider the Apostle and High-priest of our confession—Jesus

content: 2 As one faithful to him who made him: As Moses also in all his house.
content_old: 2 As one faithful to him who made him: As Moses also in all his house.

content: 3 For of more glory than Moses hath this one been counted worthy— By as much as more honour than the house hath he that prepared it;
content_old: 3 For of more glory than Moses hath this one been counted worthy— By as much as more honour than the house hath he that prepared it;

content: 4 For every house is prepared by some one,— But he that hath prepared all things is God.
content_old: 4 For every house is prepared by some one,— But he that hath prepared all things is God.

content: 5 Even Moses indeed､ was faithful in all his house, As an attendant for a witness of the things which were to be spoken;
content_old: 5 Even Moses indeed､ was faithful in all his house, As an attendant for a witness of the things which were to be spoken;

content: 6 But Christ as a Son over his house,— Whose house are we—if the freedom of speech and boast of the hope､ throughout､ firm we hold fast.
content_old: 6 But Christ as a Son over his house,— Whose house are we—if the freedom of speech and boast of the hope､ throughout､ firm we hold fast.

content: 7 Wherefore,— According as saith the Holy Spirit— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken
content_old: 7 Wherefore,— According as saith the Holy Spirit— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken

content: 8 Do not harden your hearts,— As in the embitterment､ In the day of testing in the desert,
content_old: 8 Do not harden your hearts,— As in the embitterment､ In the day of testing in the desert,

content: 9 When your fathers tested by proving, And saw my works forty years
content_old: 9 When your fathers tested by proving, And saw my works forty years

content: 10 Wherefore I was sore vexed with this generation､ And said, Always err they in their heart;— Howbeit they learned not my ways:
content_old: 10 Wherefore I was sore vexed with this generation､ And said, Always err they in their heart;— Howbeit they learned not my ways:

content: 11 So I sware in mine anger— They shall not enter into my rest!—
content_old: 11 So I sware in mine anger— They shall not enter into my rest!—

content: 12 Be taking heed､ brethren､ Lest at any time､ there shall be in any one of you､ A wicked heart of unbelief, In revolting from a Living God.
content_old: 12 Be taking heed､ brethren､ Lest at any time､ there shall be in any one of you､ A wicked heart of unbelief, In revolting from a Living God.

content: 13 But be exhorting one another､ on each successive day,— While the To-day is being named! Lest any from among you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.
content_old: 13 But be exhorting one another､ on each successive day,— While the To-day is being named! Lest any from among you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

content: 14 For partners of the Christ have we become,— If､ at least､ the beginning of the confidence､ throughout､ firm we hold fast:
content_old: 14 For partners of the Christ have we become,— If､ at least､ the beginning of the confidence､ throughout､ firm we hold fast:

content: 15 So long as it is said— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken Do not harden your hearts,— As in the embitterment.
content_old: 15 So long as it is said— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken Do not harden your hearts,— As in the embitterment.

content: 16 For who though they heard caused embitterment? Nay､ indeed! did not all who came forth out of Egypt through Moses?
content_old: 16 For who though they heard caused embitterment? Nay､ indeed! did not all who came forth out of Egypt through Moses?

content: 17 But with whom was he sore vexed forty years? Was it not with them who sinned, whose dead bodies fell in the desert?
content_old: 17 But with whom was he sore vexed forty years? Was it not with them who sinned, whose dead bodies fell in the desert?

content: 18 But unto whom sware he､ that they should not enter into his rest,— Save unto them who were obstinate?
content_old: 18 But unto whom sware he､ that they should not enter into his rest,— Save unto them who were obstinate?

content: 1 Let us therefore fear､ lest at any time, Although there is left behind a promise of entering into his rest,— Any one from amongst you should be deemed to have come short;
content_old: 1 Let us therefore fear､ lest at any time, Although there is left behind a promise of entering into his rest,— Any one from amongst you should be deemed to have come short;

content: 2 For we have had delivered to us the joyful message, just as even they; But the word which was heard did not profit them, They not having been blended､ by faith､ with the things heard.
content_old: 2 For we have had delivered to us the joyful message, just as even they; But the word which was heard did not profit them, They not having been blended､ by faith､ with the things heard.

content: 3 For we who have believed are to enter into the rest, According as he hath said— So I sware in mine anger They shall not enter into my rest; And yet the works from the foundation of the world had been brought into existence,
content_old: 3 For we who have believed are to enter into the rest, According as he hath said— So I sware in mine anger They shall not enter into my rest; And yet the works from the foundation of the world had been brought into existence,

content: 4 For he hath spoken､ somewhere､ concerning the seventh day, thus— And God rested､ on the seventh day from all his works;
content_old: 4 For he hath spoken､ somewhere､ concerning the seventh day, thus— And God rested､ on the seventh day from all his works;

content: 5 And in this again— They shall not enter into my rest.
content_old: 5 And in this again— They shall not enter into my rest.

content: 6 Seeing､ therefore､ that it is left over for some to enter into it, And they who formerly had delivered to them the joyful message entered not in by reason of obstinacy,—
content_old: 6 Seeing､ therefore､ that it is left over for some to enter into it, And they who formerly had delivered to them the joyful message entered not in by reason of obstinacy,—

content: 7 Again he marketh out a certain day, To-day in David saying—after so long a time as this,—according as it hath been said before:— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken Do not harden your hearts.
content_old: 7 Again he marketh out a certain day, To-day in David saying—after so long a time as this,—according as it hath been said before:— To-day if unto his voice ye would hearken Do not harden your hearts.

content: 8 For if unto them Joshua had given rest It had not in that case concerning another day been speaking after these things.
content_old: 8 For if unto them Joshua had given rest It had not in that case concerning another day been speaking after these things.

content: 9 Hence there is left over A Sabbath-keeping､ for the people of God.
content_old: 9 Hence there is left over A Sabbath-keeping､ for the people of God.

content: 10 For he that hath entered into his rest He too hath rested from his works,—just as from his own God rested.
content_old: 10 For he that hath entered into his rest He too hath rested from his works,—just as from his own God rested.

content: 11 Let us､ therefore､ give diligence to enter into that rest, Lest anyone fall into the same example of obstinacy.
content_old: 11 Let us､ therefore､ give diligence to enter into that rest, Lest anyone fall into the same example of obstinacy.

content: 12 For living is the word of God､ and energetic, And more cutting than any knife with two edges, And penetrating as far as a dividing asunder of soul and spirit､ Of joints also､ and marrow,— And able to judge the impulses and designs of the heart;
content_old: 12 For living is the word of God､ and energetic, And more cutting than any knife with two edges, And penetrating as far as a dividing asunder of soul and spirit､ Of joints also､ and marrow,— And able to judge the impulses and designs of the heart;

content: 13 And there is no created thing can be secreted before him, But all things are naked and exposed to his eyes:— As to whom is our discourse.
content_old: 13 And there is no created thing can be secreted before him, But all things are naked and exposed to his eyes:— As to whom is our discourse.

content: 14 Having then a great high-priest who hath passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God Let us hold fast the confession;
content_old: 14 Having then a great high-priest who hath passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God Let us hold fast the confession;

content: 15 For we have not a high-priest unable to have fellow-feeling with our weaknesses, But one tested in all respects､ by way of likeness, apart from sin.
content_old: 15 For we have not a high-priest unable to have fellow-feeling with our weaknesses, But one tested in all respects､ by way of likeness, apart from sin.

content: 1 For every high-priest who from among men is taken On behalf of men is appointed､ as to the things pertaining unto God, That he may be offering both gifts and sacrifices for sins,—
content_old: 1 For every high-priest who from among men is taken On behalf of men is appointed､ as to the things pertaining unto God, That he may be offering both gifts and sacrifices for sins,—

content: 2 Able to have a measure of feeling for the ignorant and erring,— Since he also is compassed with weakness;
content_old: 2 Able to have a measure of feeling for the ignorant and erring,— Since he also is compassed with weakness;

content: 3 And for this cause is he obliged— As for the people､ So also for himself,— To be offering for sins;
content_old: 3 And for this cause is he obliged— As for the people､ So also for himself,— To be offering for sins;

content: 4 And not unto himself doth one take the honour, But when called by God､ Just as even Aaron:
content_old: 4 And not unto himself doth one take the honour, But when called by God､ Just as even Aaron:

content: 5 Thus also the Christ glorified not himself to become a high-priest, But he that spake unto him— My Sonart thou, I this day have begotten thee;
content_old: 5 Thus also the Christ glorified not himself to become a high-priest, But he that spake unto him— My Sonart thou, I this day have begotten thee;

content: 6 As also in a different place he saith— Thou art a priest age-abidingly, According to the rank of Melchizedek:
content_old: 6 As also in a different place he saith— Thou art a priest age-abidingly, According to the rank of Melchizedek:

content: 7 Who in the days of his flesh Having offered up both supplications and entreaties Unto him that was able to save him out of death､ With mighty outcries and tears, And been hearkened to by reason of his devoutness
content_old: 7 Who in the days of his flesh Having offered up both supplications and entreaties Unto him that was able to save him out of death､ With mighty outcries and tears, And been hearkened to by reason of his devoutness

content: 8 Even though he was a son Yet learned､ from what things he suffered､ obedience;
content_old: 8 Even though he was a son Yet learned､ from what things he suffered､ obedience;

content: 9 And being made perfect､ Became to all them that obey him Author of salvation age-abiding;
content_old: 9 And being made perfect､ Became to all them that obey him Author of salvation age-abiding;

content: 10 Being addressed by God as high-priest— According to the rank of Melchizedek.
content_old: 10 Being addressed by God as high-priest— According to the rank of Melchizedek.

content: 11 Concerning whom great is our discourse､ And of difficult interpretation to express, Seeing that slothful have ye become in the hearing;
content_old: 11 Concerning whom great is our discourse､ And of difficult interpretation to express, Seeing that slothful have ye become in the hearing;

content: 12 For even when ye ought to be teachers by reason of the time Again have ye need that one be teaching you What are the first principles of the oracles of God, And have become such as have need of milk not of strong food;
content_old: 12 For even when ye ought to be teachers by reason of the time Again have ye need that one be teaching you What are the first principles of the oracles of God, And have become such as have need of milk not of strong food;

content: 13 For every one partaking of milk is unskilled in discourse of righteousness, For he is a babe;
content_old: 13 For every one partaking of milk is unskilled in discourse of righteousness, For he is a babe;

content: 1 Wherefore dismissing the elementary discourse concerning the Christ Unto maturity let us be tending, Not again､ a foundation laying down— Of repentance from dead works､ And of faith towards God,
content_old: 1 Wherefore dismissing the elementary discourse concerning the Christ Unto maturity let us be tending, Not again､ a foundation laying down— Of repentance from dead works､ And of faith towards God,

content: 2 Of immersions—in respect of teaching､ And of the laying on of hands, Of the resurrection of the dead､ And of judgment age-abiding;—
content_old: 2 Of immersions—in respect of teaching､ And of the laying on of hands, Of the resurrection of the dead､ And of judgment age-abiding;—

content: 3 And this will we do if at least God permit.
content_old: 3 And this will we do if at least God permit.

content: 4 For it is impossible— As to those who have been once for all illuminated､ Who have tasted also of the heavenly free-gift､ And have been made partners in a Holy Spirit､
content_old: 4 For it is impossible— As to those who have been once for all illuminated､ Who have tasted also of the heavenly free-gift､ And have been made partners in a Holy Spirit､

content: 5 And have tasted God’s utterance to be sweet､ Mighty works also of a coming age,
content_old: 5 And have tasted God’s utterance to be sweet､ Mighty works also of a coming age,

content: 6 And who have fallen away Again to be remoulding them into repentance; Seeing they are again crucifying unto themselves the Son of God､ And holding him up as an example.
content_old: 6 And who have fallen away Again to be remoulding them into repentance; Seeing they are again crucifying unto themselves the Son of God､ And holding him up as an example.

content: 7 For land which hath drunk in the rain thereupon ofttimes coming､ And which bringeth forth vegetation fit for them for whom it is even cultivated Partaketh of a blessing from God;
content_old: 7 For land which hath drunk in the rain thereupon ofttimes coming､ And which bringeth forth vegetation fit for them for whom it is even cultivated Partaketh of a blessing from God;

content: 8 But should it be bringing forth thorns and briars It is disapproved, and､ unto cursing､ nigh,— Whose end is for burning.
content_old: 8 But should it be bringing forth thorns and briars It is disapproved, and､ unto cursing､ nigh,— Whose end is for burning.

content: 9 But we are persuaded, concerning you､ beloved, The things which are better and which contain salvation, Though even thus we speak.
content_old: 9 But we are persuaded, concerning you､ beloved, The things which are better and which contain salvation, Though even thus we speak.

content: 10 For not unrighteous is God､ to be forgetful of your work and of the love which ye have shewn forth for his name, In that ye have ministered unto the saints､ and are ministering,—
content_old: 10 For not unrighteous is God､ to be forgetful of your work and of the love which ye have shewn forth for his name, In that ye have ministered unto the saints､ and are ministering,—

content: 11 But we covet That each one of you be shewing forth the same diligence､ Unto the full assurance of the hope throughout:
content_old: 11 But we covet That each one of you be shewing forth the same diligence､ Unto the full assurance of the hope throughout:

content: 12 In order that not slothful ye may become, But imitators of them who､ through faith and patience､ were becoming heirs of the promises.
content_old: 12 In order that not slothful ye may become, But imitators of them who､ through faith and patience､ were becoming heirs of the promises.

content: 13 For when to Abraham God made promise Seeing he had no one greater by whom to swear He sware by himself,—
content_old: 13 For when to Abraham God made promise Seeing he had no one greater by whom to swear He sware by himself,—

content: 14 saying— Truly､ if blessing I will bless thee､ And multiplying I will multiply thee;
content_old: 14 saying— Truly､ if blessing I will bless thee､ And multiplying I will multiply thee;

content: 15 And thus､ being patient he attained unto the promise.
content_old: 15 And thus､ being patient he attained unto the promise.

content: 16 For men by the greater one swear, And with them an end of all gainsaying by way of confirmation is the oath:
content_old: 16 For men by the greater one swear, And with them an end of all gainsaying by way of confirmation is the oath:

content: 17 Wherein God being more abundantly disposed to shew forth unto the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of his counsel Mediated with an oath,—
content_old: 17 Wherein God being more abundantly disposed to shew forth unto the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of his counsel Mediated with an oath,—

content: 18 In order that through means of two unchangeable things､ In which it was impossible for God to make himself false A mighty consolation we might have､ Who have fled along to grasp the forelying hope,
content_old: 18 In order that through means of two unchangeable things､ In which it was impossible for God to make himself false A mighty consolation we might have､ Who have fled along to grasp the forelying hope,

content: 19 Which we have as an anchor of the soul､ Both secure and firm, And entering into the interior of the veil:
content_old: 19 Which we have as an anchor of the soul､ Both secure and firm, And entering into the interior of the veil:

content: 1 For this Melchizedek､ king of Salem､ priest of God Most High, Who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings､ and blessed him,—
content_old: 1 For this Melchizedek､ king of Salem､ priest of God Most High, Who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings､ and blessed him,—

content: 2 To whom even a tenth of all Abraham apportioned First､ indeed､ when translated､ King of Righteousness, But after that King of Salem also, which is King of Peace,—
content_old: 2 To whom even a tenth of all Abraham apportioned First､ indeed､ when translated､ King of Righteousness, But after that King of Salem also, which is King of Peace,—

content: 3 Without father､ without mother､ without pedigree, Having neither beginning of days､ nor of life an end, But made like unto the Son of God Abideth a priest evermore.
content_old: 3 Without father､ without mother､ without pedigree, Having neither beginning of days､ nor of life an end, But made like unto the Son of God Abideth a priest evermore.

content: 4 Now consider how great this man was､ to whom a tenth Abraham gave out of the choicest spoils Yea Abraham the Patriarch.
content_old: 4 Now consider how great this man was､ to whom a tenth Abraham gave out of the choicest spoils Yea Abraham the Patriarch.

content: 5 And they､ indeed､ from among the sons of Levi who the priesthood receive Have commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law,— That is､ of their brethren, although sprung from the loins of Abraham;
content_old: 5 And they､ indeed､ from among the sons of Levi who the priesthood receive Have commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law,— That is､ of their brethren, although sprung from the loins of Abraham;

content: 6 But he who deriveth not his pedigree from among them Hath taken tithes of Abraham. And the holder of the promises hath he blessed.
content_old: 6 But he who deriveth not his pedigree from among them Hath taken tithes of Abraham. And the holder of the promises hath he blessed.

content: 7 But apart from all gainsaying The less by the greater is blessed.
content_old: 7 But apart from all gainsaying The less by the greater is blessed.

content: 8 And here indeed､ dying men take tithes, But there one of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.
content_old: 8 And here indeed､ dying men take tithes, But there one of whom it is witnessed that he liveth.

content: 9 And—so to say a word— Through Abraham even Levi who taketh tithes hath paid tithes;
content_old: 9 And—so to say a word— Through Abraham even Levi who taketh tithes hath paid tithes;

content: 10 For even then was he in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him.
content_old: 10 For even then was he in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him.

content: 11 If indeed､ therefore､ there had been a perfecting through means of the Levitical priesthood,— For the people､ thereon have had based a code of laws What further need according to the rank of Melchizedek for a different priest to be raised up, And not according to the rank of Aaron to be designated?
content_old: 11 If indeed､ therefore､ there had been a perfecting through means of the Levitical priesthood,— For the people､ thereon have had based a code of laws What further need according to the rank of Melchizedek for a different priest to be raised up, And not according to the rank of Aaron to be designated?

content: 12 For seeing there is to be a change of the priesthood Of necessity of law too a change cometh.
content_old: 12 For seeing there is to be a change of the priesthood Of necessity of law too a change cometh.

content: 13 For he as to whom these things are said With a different tribe hath taken partnership, From which no one hath given attendance at the altar;
content_old: 13 For he as to whom these things are said With a different tribe hath taken partnership, From which no one hath given attendance at the altar;

content: 14 For it is very evident that out of Judah hath sprung our Lord,— Respecting which tribe concerning priests nothing did Moses speak,
content_old: 14 For it is very evident that out of Judah hath sprung our Lord,— Respecting which tribe concerning priests nothing did Moses speak,

content: 15 And yet more abundantly evident it is— That according to the likeness of Melchizedek there is to be raised up a different priest､
content_old: 15 And yet more abundantly evident it is— That according to the likeness of Melchizedek there is to be raised up a different priest､

content: 16 Who not according to a law of commandment dealing with the flesh hath arisen､ But according to the power of an indissoluble life;
content_old: 16 Who not according to a law of commandment dealing with the flesh hath arisen､ But according to the power of an indissoluble life;

content: 17 For it is witnessed— Thou art a priest age-abidingly, According to the rank of Melchizedek.
content_old: 17 For it is witnessed— Thou art a priest age-abidingly, According to the rank of Melchizedek.

content: 18 For a setting aside doth､ indeed､ take place, of a foregoing commandment, By reason of its own weakness and unprofitableness,—
content_old: 18 For a setting aside doth､ indeed､ take place, of a foregoing commandment, By reason of its own weakness and unprofitableness,—

content: 19 For the law perfected nothing; But there is the superinducing of a better hope,— Through which we draw near unto God.
content_old: 19 For the law perfected nothing; But there is the superinducing of a better hope,— Through which we draw near unto God.

content: 20 And inasmuch as not apart from oath-taking—
content_old: 20 And inasmuch as not apart from oath-taking—

content: 21 For they indeed､ apart from oath-taking have been made priests, But he with an oath-taking,— Through him that was saying unto him— The Lord sware､ and will not regret,— Thou art a priest age-abidingly
content_old: 21 For they indeed､ apart from oath-taking have been made priests, But he with an oath-taking,— Through him that was saying unto him— The Lord sware､ and will not regret,— Thou art a priest age-abidingly

content: 22 By as much as this hath Jesus become surety of a better covenant also.
content_old: 22 By as much as this hath Jesus become surety of a better covenant also.

content: 23 And they indeed､ in greater numbers have been made priests, Because by reason of death are they hindered from remaining at hand;
content_old: 23 And they indeed､ in greater numbers have been made priests, Because by reason of death are they hindered from remaining at hand;

content: 24 But he, by reason of his remaining age-abidingly, Untransmissible holdeth the priesthood.
content_old: 24 But he, by reason of his remaining age-abidingly, Untransmissible holdeth the priesthood.

content: 25 Whence he is able even to be saving unto the very end Them who approach､ through him､ unto God; Since he evermore liveth to be interceding in their behalf.
content_old: 25 Whence he is able even to be saving unto the very end Them who approach､ through him､ unto God; Since he evermore liveth to be interceding in their behalf.

content: 26 For such a high-priest as this for us was even suited: Loving､ noble､ undefiled, Set apart from sinners, And become higher than the heavens;
content_old: 26 For such a high-priest as this for us was even suited: Loving､ noble､ undefiled, Set apart from sinners, And become higher than the heavens;

content: 27 Who hath no daily necessity､ like the high-priests, Beforehand､ over his own sins to be offering sacrifices, After that over those of the people,— For this he did once for all when himself he offered up.
content_old: 27 Who hath no daily necessity､ like the high-priests, Beforehand､ over his own sins to be offering sacrifices, After that over those of the people,— For this he did once for all when himself he offered up.

content: 1 A crowning point on the things being spoken:— Such a one as this have we as high-priest, Who hath sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,—
content_old: 1 A crowning point on the things being spoken:— Such a one as this have we as high-priest, Who hath sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,—

content: 2 Of the Holy place a public minister､ And of the Real Tent､ which the Lord pitched and not man.
content_old: 2 Of the Holy place a public minister､ And of the Real Tent､ which the Lord pitched and not man.

content: 3 For every high-priest for the offering of both gifts and sacrifices is constituted; Whence it was necessary for this one also to have something which he might offer.
content_old: 3 For every high-priest for the offering of both gifts and sacrifices is constituted; Whence it was necessary for this one also to have something which he might offer.

content: 4 If､ indeed､ therefore､ he had been on earth He had not､ in that case､ even been a priest, Since there are those who are offering the gifts according to the law:—
content_old: 4 If､ indeed､ therefore､ he had been on earth He had not､ in that case､ even been a priest, Since there are those who are offering the gifts according to the law:—

content: 5 Who､ indeed､ are rendering divine service､ with a glimpse and shadow of the heavenly things; Even as Moses hath received intimation､ when about to complete the tent,— For see! saith he—Thou shalt make all things according to the model which hath been pointed out to thee in the mount.
content_old: 5 Who､ indeed､ are rendering divine service､ with a glimpse and shadow of the heavenly things; Even as Moses hath received intimation､ when about to complete the tent,— For see! saith he—Thou shalt make all things according to the model which hath been pointed out to thee in the mount.

content: 6 But now hath he attained unto a more distinguished public ministry,— By as much as of a better covenant also he is mediator, Which indeed upon better promises hath been legislated.
content_old: 6 But now hath he attained unto a more distinguished public ministry,— By as much as of a better covenant also he is mediator, Which indeed upon better promises hath been legislated.

content: 7 For if that first had been faultless, Not､ in that case､ for a second had there been sought a place.
content_old: 7 For if that first had been faultless, Not､ in that case､ for a second had there been sought a place.

content: 8 For finding fault with them he saith— Lo! days are coming､ saith the Lord, When I will conclude､ for the house of Israel and the house of Judah､ A covenant of a new sort:
content_old: 8 For finding fault with them he saith— Lo! days are coming､ saith the Lord, When I will conclude､ for the house of Israel and the house of Judah､ A covenant of a new sort:

content: 9 Not according to the covenant which I made with their fathers､ In the day when I took them by their hand､ to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt,— Because they abode not in my covenant､ And I disregarded them, saith the Lord.
content_old: 9 Not according to the covenant which I made with their fathers､ In the day when I took them by their hand､ to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt,— Because they abode not in my covenant､ And I disregarded them, saith the Lord.

content: 10 Because this is the covenant which I will make with the house of Israel､ After those days saith the Lord:— Giving my laws into their understanding Upon their hearts also will I inscribe them: And I will become their God, And they shall become my people;
content_old: 10 Because this is the covenant which I will make with the house of Israel､ After those days saith the Lord:— Giving my laws into their understanding Upon their hearts also will I inscribe them: And I will become their God, And they shall become my people;

content: 11 And in nowise shall they teach— Every one his fellow-citizen､ And every one his brother, Saying,—Get to know the Lord! Because all shall know me､ From the least unto the greatest of them;
content_old: 11 And in nowise shall they teach— Every one his fellow-citizen､ And every one his brother, Saying,—Get to know the Lord! Because all shall know me､ From the least unto the greatest of them;

content: 12 Because propitious will I be as to their unrighteousnesses, And of their sins in nowise will I be mindful any more.
content_old: 12 Because propitious will I be as to their unrighteousnesses, And of their sins in nowise will I be mindful any more.

content: 1 Even the first､ indeed､ therefore､ used to have righteous appointments of divine service, Even the holy ritual well arranged.
content_old: 1 Even the first､ indeed､ therefore､ used to have righteous appointments of divine service, Even the holy ritual well arranged.

content: 2 For a tent was prepared, the first､ In which were both the lampstand and the table and the setting forth of the loaves,— The which is called the Holy place;
content_old: 2 For a tent was prepared, the first､ In which were both the lampstand and the table and the setting forth of the loaves,— The which is called the Holy place;

content: 3 But after the second veil a tent, that which is called Most Holy:
content_old: 3 But after the second veil a tent, that which is called Most Holy:

content: 4 Having a golden altar of incense､ And the ark of the covenant covered around on every side with gold, In which was a golden jar holding the manna､ And the rod of Aaron that sprouted､ And the tables of the covenant;
content_old: 4 Having a golden altar of incense､ And the ark of the covenant covered around on every side with gold, In which was a golden jar holding the manna､ And the rod of Aaron that sprouted､ And the tables of the covenant;

content: 5 But over-above it Cherubim of glory over-shadowing the propitiatory:— Concerning which things it is not now needful to be speaking particularly.
content_old: 5 But over-above it Cherubim of glory over-shadowing the propitiatory:— Concerning which things it is not now needful to be speaking particularly.

content: 6 Now these things having been thus prepared Into the first tent､ indeed､ continually do the priests enter, The divine services completing;
content_old: 6 Now these things having been thus prepared Into the first tent､ indeed､ continually do the priests enter, The divine services completing;

content: 7 But into the secondonce for all in the year, Only the high-priest､ Not without blood､ Which he offered for himself and the ignorances of the people:
content_old: 7 But into the secondonce for all in the year, Only the high-priest､ Not without blood､ Which he offered for himself and the ignorances of the people:

content: 8 The Holy Spirit making this evident— That not yet hath been manifested､ the way through the Holy place, So long as the first tent hath a standing.
content_old: 8 The Holy Spirit making this evident— That not yet hath been manifested､ the way through the Holy place, So long as the first tent hath a standing.

content: 9 The which is a similitude for the present season, According to which both gifts and sacrifices are offered､ Which cannot as to the conscience perfect him that rendereth the divine service:—
content_old: 9 The which is a similitude for the present season, According to which both gifts and sacrifices are offered､ Which cannot as to the conscience perfect him that rendereth the divine service:—

content: 10 Only as to eatings､ and drinkings､ and diversified immersions,— Righteous-appointments of the flesh､ Which until a season of rectifying are in force.
content_old: 10 Only as to eatings､ and drinkings､ and diversified immersions,— Righteous-appointments of the flesh､ Which until a season of rectifying are in force.

content: 11 But when Christ approached､ as high-priest of the coming good things, Through the greater and more perfect tent､ not made by hand, That is､ not of this creation,—
content_old: 11 But when Christ approached､ as high-priest of the coming good things, Through the greater and more perfect tent､ not made by hand, That is､ not of this creation,—

content: 12 Nor yet through blood of goats and calves､ But through his own blood He entered once for all into the Holy place, Age-abiding redemption discovering.
content_old: 12 Nor yet through blood of goats and calves､ But through his own blood He entered once for all into the Holy place, Age-abiding redemption discovering.

content: 13 For if the blood of goats and bulls､ And the ashes of a heifer sprinkling the profaned, Halloweth unto the purity of the flesh
content_old: 13 For if the blood of goats and bulls､ And the ashes of a heifer sprinkling the profaned, Halloweth unto the purity of the flesh

content: 14 How much rather shall the blood of the Christ､ Who through an age-abiding spirit Offered himself unspotted unto God Purify our conscience from dead works､ To the rendering of divine-service unto a Living God ?
content_old: 14 How much rather shall the blood of the Christ､ Who through an age-abiding spirit Offered himself unspotted unto God Purify our conscience from dead works､ To the rendering of divine-service unto a Living God ?

content: 15 And for this cause of a new covenant is he mediator,— To the end that death coming to pass for the redemption of the transgressions against the first covenant The called might receive the promise of the age-abiding inheritance;
content_old: 15 And for this cause of a new covenant is he mediator,— To the end that death coming to pass for the redemption of the transgressions against the first covenant The called might receive the promise of the age-abiding inheritance;

content: 16 For where a covenant is It is necessary for the death to be brought in､ of him that hath covenanted;
content_old: 16 For where a covenant is It is necessary for the death to be brought in､ of him that hath covenanted;

content: 17 For a covenant over dead persons is firm,— Since it is not then of force when he is living that hath covenanted.
content_old: 17 For a covenant over dead persons is firm,— Since it is not then of force when he is living that hath covenanted.

content: 18 Whence not even the first apart from blood hath been consecrated;
content_old: 18 Whence not even the first apart from blood hath been consecrated;

content: 19 For when every commandment according to the law had been spoken by Moses unto all the people Taking the blood of the calves and the goats､ With water and scarlet wool and hyssop, Both the scroll itself､ and all the people he sprinkled;
content_old: 19 For when every commandment according to the law had been spoken by Moses unto all the people Taking the blood of the calves and the goats､ With water and scarlet wool and hyssop, Both the scroll itself､ and all the people he sprinkled;

content: 20 Saying— This is the blood of the covenant which God hath sent in command unto you:
content_old: 20 Saying— This is the blood of the covenant which God hath sent in command unto you:

content: 21 Yea the tent also､ and all the utensils of the public ministry with blood in like manner he sprinkled:
content_old: 21 Yea the tent also､ and all the utensils of the public ministry with blood in like manner he sprinkled:

content: 22 And nearly all things with blood are purified according to the law, And apart from blood-shedding cometh no remission.
content_old: 22 And nearly all things with blood are purified according to the law, And apart from blood-shedding cometh no remission.

content: 23 It was indeed therefore necessary for the glimpses of the things in the heavens with these to be purified; But the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
content_old: 23 It was indeed therefore necessary for the glimpses of the things in the heavens with these to be purified; But the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

content: 24 For not into a Holy place made by hand entered Christ,— Counterpart of the real Holy place; But into the heaven itself, Now to be plainly manifested before the face of God in our behalf;—
content_old: 24 For not into a Holy place made by hand entered Christ,— Counterpart of the real Holy place; But into the heaven itself, Now to be plainly manifested before the face of God in our behalf;—

content: 25 Nor yet that ofttimes he should be offering himself,— Just as the high-priest entereth into the Holy place､ year by year､ with alien blood;—
content_old: 25 Nor yet that ofttimes he should be offering himself,— Just as the high-priest entereth into the Holy place､ year by year､ with alien blood;—

content: 26 Else had it been needful for him ofttimes to suffer､ from the foundation of the world; But now once for all Upon a conjunction of the ages, For a setting aside of sin through means of his sacrifice Hath he been made manifest;
content_old: 26 Else had it been needful for him ofttimes to suffer､ from the foundation of the world; But now once for all Upon a conjunction of the ages, For a setting aside of sin through means of his sacrifice Hath he been made manifest;

content: 27 And inasmuch as it is in store for men— Once for all to die､ But after this judgment
content_old: 27 And inasmuch as it is in store for men— Once for all to die､ But after this judgment

content: 1 For the law having a shadow of the destined good things､ Not the very image of the things They can never with the same sacrifices which year by year they offer evermore Make them who approach perfect;
content_old: 1 For the law having a shadow of the destined good things､ Not the very image of the things They can never with the same sacrifices which year by year they offer evermore Make them who approach perfect;

content: 2 Else would they not､ in that case､ have ceased being offered, By reason of those rendering the divine service having no further conscience at all of sins､ Being once for all purified?
content_old: 2 Else would they not､ in that case､ have ceased being offered, By reason of those rendering the divine service having no further conscience at all of sins､ Being once for all purified?

content: 3 But in them is a recalling to mind of sins year by year,
content_old: 3 But in them is a recalling to mind of sins year by year,

content: 4 For it is impossible for blood of bulls and goats to be taking away sins.
content_old: 4 For it is impossible for blood of bulls and goats to be taking away sins.

content: 5 Wherefore coming into the world he saith: Sacrifice and offering thou willedst not, But a body hast thou fitted for me,—
content_old: 5 Wherefore coming into the world he saith: Sacrifice and offering thou willedst not, But a body hast thou fitted for me,—

content: 6 In whole-burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sins thou didst not delight:
content_old: 6 In whole-burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sins thou didst not delight:

content: 7 Then said I— Lo! I am come,— In the heading of the scroll it is written concerning me,— To do､ O God､ thy will.
content_old: 7 Then said I— Lo! I am come,— In the heading of the scroll it is written concerning me,— To do､ O God､ thy will.

content: 8 Higher up saying— Sacrifices､ and offerings, and whole-burnt-offerings､ and sacrifices for sins thou willedst not､ neither delightedst in,— The which according to the law are offered
content_old: 8 Higher up saying— Sacrifices､ and offerings, and whole-burnt-offerings､ and sacrifices for sins thou willedst not､ neither delightedst in,— The which according to the law are offered

content: 9 Then hath he said— Lo! I am come! To do thy will:— He taketh away the first, that the second he may establish:
content_old: 9 Then hath he said— Lo! I am come! To do thy will:— He taketh away the first, that the second he may establish:

content: 10 By which will we have been made holy､ Through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
content_old: 10 By which will we have been made holy､ Through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

content: 11 And every priest､ indeed､ standeth daily publicly ministering, And the same sacrifices ofttimes offering､ The which never can clear away sins;
content_old: 11 And every priest､ indeed､ standeth daily publicly ministering, And the same sacrifices ofttimes offering､ The which never can clear away sins;

content: 12 But this priest having offered one sacrifice for sins evermore Sat down on the right hand of God:
content_old: 12 But this priest having offered one sacrifice for sins evermore Sat down on the right hand of God:

content: 13 As for the rest waiting— Until his foes be made his footstool;
content_old: 13 As for the rest waiting— Until his foes be made his footstool;

content: 14 For by one offering hath he perfected for evermore､ them who are being made holy.
content_old: 14 For by one offering hath he perfected for evermore､ them who are being made holy.

content: 15 But even the Holy Spirit beareth us witness; For after having said—
content_old: 15 But even the Holy Spirit beareth us witness; For after having said—

content: 16 This is the covenant which I will covenant unto them After those days, saith the Lord,— Giving my laws upon their hearts, Upon their understandings also will I inscribe them
content_old: 16 This is the covenant which I will covenant unto them After those days, saith the Lord,— Giving my laws upon their hearts, Upon their understandings also will I inscribe them

content: 17 He also saith— Of their sins, and of their lawlessnesses I will in nowise be mindful any more.
content_old: 17 He also saith— Of their sins, and of their lawlessnesses I will in nowise be mindful any more.

content: 18 But wherever a remission of these is there is no further offering for sins.
content_old: 18 But wherever a remission of these is there is no further offering for sins.

content: 19 Having therefore､ brethren､ freedom of speech for the entrance through the Holy place by the blood of Jesus,
content_old: 19 Having therefore､ brethren､ freedom of speech for the entrance through the Holy place by the blood of Jesus,

content: 20 Which entrance he hath consecrated for us､ as a way recent and living､ Through the veil､ that is､ his flesh,—
content_old: 20 Which entrance he hath consecrated for us､ as a way recent and living､ Through the veil､ that is､ his flesh,—

content: 21 And having a great priest over the house of God
content_old: 21 And having a great priest over the house of God

content: 22 Let us approach with a genuine heart､ in full assurance of faith, Having been sprinkled､ as to our hearts､ from an evil conscience, And bathed､ as to our bodies､ with pure water;
content_old: 22 Let us approach with a genuine heart､ in full assurance of faith, Having been sprinkled､ as to our hearts､ from an evil conscience, And bathed､ as to our bodies､ with pure water;

content: 23 Let us hold fast the confession of the hope without wavering,— For faithful is he that hath promised;
content_old: 23 Let us hold fast the confession of the hope without wavering,— For faithful is he that hath promised;

content: 24 And let us attentively consider one another､ to provoke unto love and noble works,—
content_old: 24 And let us attentively consider one another､ to provoke unto love and noble works,—

content: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together､ According to the custom of some, But exhorting, And by so much the more as this､ By as much as ye behold the day drawing near.
content_old: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together､ According to the custom of some, But exhorting, And by so much the more as this､ By as much as ye behold the day drawing near.

content: 26 For if by choice we be sinning､ after the receiving of the full-knowledge of the truth No longer for sins is there left over a sacrifice,
content_old: 26 For if by choice we be sinning､ after the receiving of the full-knowledge of the truth No longer for sins is there left over a sacrifice,

content: 27 But some fearful reception of judgment and fiery jealousy､ About to devour the opposers.
content_old: 27 But some fearful reception of judgment and fiery jealousy､ About to devour the opposers.

content: 28 Any one having set aside a law of Moses Apart from compassions､ upon the testimony of two or three witnesses dieth:
content_old: 28 Any one having set aside a law of Moses Apart from compassions､ upon the testimony of two or three witnesses dieth:

content: 29 Of how much sorer punishment､ suppose ye､ shall he be accounted worthy, Who hath trampled underfoot the Son of God､ And the blood of the covenant hath esteemed a profane thing by which he had been made holy, And unto the Spirit of favour hath offered wanton insult?
content_old: 29 Of how much sorer punishment､ suppose ye､ shall he be accounted worthy, Who hath trampled underfoot the Son of God､ And the blood of the covenant hath esteemed a profane thing by which he had been made holy, And unto the Spirit of favour hath offered wanton insult?

content: 30 For we know him that hath said— To me belongeth avenging, I will recompense; and again— The Lord will judge his people.
content_old: 30 For we know him that hath said— To me belongeth avenging, I will recompense; and again— The Lord will judge his people.

content: 31 A fearful thing it is to fall into the hands of a Living God.
content_old: 31 A fearful thing it is to fall into the hands of a Living God.

content: 32 But be calling to mind the former days, In which once ye were illuminated､ A great combat of sufferings ye endured;—
content_old: 32 But be calling to mind the former days, In which once ye were illuminated､ A great combat of sufferings ye endured;—

content: 33 Partly､ indeed､ because both with reproaches and tribulations ye were being made a spectacle, But partly because into fellowship with them who were so involved ye were brought;—
content_old: 33 Partly､ indeed､ because both with reproaches and tribulations ye were being made a spectacle, But partly because into fellowship with them who were so involved ye were brought;—

content: 34 For even with them who were in bonds ye sympathised, And unto the seizure of your goods with joy ye bade welcome,— Knowing that ye have yourselves､ for a better possession and an abiding.
content_old: 34 For even with them who were in bonds ye sympathised, And unto the seizure of your goods with joy ye bade welcome,— Knowing that ye have yourselves､ for a better possession and an abiding.

content: 35 Do not､ then､ cast away your freedom of speech,— The which hath a great recompense.
content_old: 35 Do not､ then､ cast away your freedom of speech,— The which hath a great recompense.

content: 36 For of endurance ye have need､ In order that the will of God having done Ye may bear away the promise.
content_old: 36 For of endurance ye have need､ In order that the will of God having done Ye may bear away the promise.

content: 37 For yet a little while､ how short! how short! The Coming One will be here､ and will not tarry;
content_old: 37 For yet a little while､ how short! how short! The Coming One will be here､ and will not tarry;

content: 38 But my righteous one by faith shall live, And if he draw back my soul delighteth not in him.
content_old: 38 But my righteous one by faith shall live, And if he draw back my soul delighteth not in him.

content: 1 But faith is of things hoped for a confidence, Of facts a conviction when they are not seen;
content_old: 1 But faith is of things hoped for a confidence, Of facts a conviction when they are not seen;

content: 2 For thereby well-attested were the ancients.
content_old: 2 For thereby well-attested were the ancients.

content: 3 By faith we understand the ages to have been fitted together by declaration of God,— To the end that not out of things appearing should that which is seen have come into existence.
content_old: 3 By faith we understand the ages to have been fitted together by declaration of God,— To the end that not out of things appearing should that which is seen have come into existence.

content: 4 By faith a fuller sacrifice did Abel offer unto God than Cain,— Through which he received witness that he was righteous, There being a witnessing upon his gifts by God; And through it though he died he yet is speaking.
content_old: 4 By faith a fuller sacrifice did Abel offer unto God than Cain,— Through which he received witness that he was righteous, There being a witnessing upon his gifts by God; And through it though he died he yet is speaking.

content: 5 By faith Enoch was translated､ so as not to see death, And was not found､ because that God had translated him; For before the translation he had received witness that he had become well-pleasing unto God;—
content_old: 5 By faith Enoch was translated､ so as not to see death, And was not found､ because that God had translated him; For before the translation he had received witness that he had become well-pleasing unto God;—

content: 6 But apart from faith it is impossible to be well-pleasing; For he that approacheth unto God— Must needs have faith that he is, And that to them who seek him out a rewarder he becometh.
content_old: 6 But apart from faith it is impossible to be well-pleasing; For he that approacheth unto God— Must needs have faith that he is, And that to them who seek him out a rewarder he becometh.

content: 7 By faith Noah having received intimation concerning the things not yet seen Filled with reverence prepared an ark to the saving of his house— Through which he condemned the world, And of the righteousness by way of faith became heir.
content_old: 7 By faith Noah having received intimation concerning the things not yet seen Filled with reverence prepared an ark to the saving of his house— Through which he condemned the world, And of the righteousness by way of faith became heir.

content: 8 By faith being called Abraham obeyed— To come forth into a place he was destined to receive for an inheritance; And he came forth､ not well knowing whither he was coming.
content_old: 8 By faith being called Abraham obeyed— To come forth into a place he was destined to receive for an inheritance; And he came forth､ not well knowing whither he was coming.

content: 9 By faith he sojourned in the land of promise as a foreign land, In tents dwelling､ Along with Isaac and Jacob､ the joint-heirs of the same promise;
content_old: 9 By faith he sojourned in the land of promise as a foreign land, In tents dwelling､ Along with Isaac and Jacob､ the joint-heirs of the same promise;

content: 10 For he was awaiting the city having foundations, Whose architect and builder is God.
content_old: 10 For he was awaiting the city having foundations, Whose architect and builder is God.

content: 11 By faith even Sarah herself received power for founding a seed, Even beyond the season of life’s prime,— Seeing that faithful she reckoned him that had promised;
content_old: 11 By faith even Sarah herself received power for founding a seed, Even beyond the season of life’s prime,— Seeing that faithful she reckoned him that had promised;

content: 12 Wherefore even from one were born, And as to these things one who had become dead,— Like the stars of the heaven､ for multitude, And as the sand that is by the lip of the sea､ that cannot be numbered.
content_old: 12 Wherefore even from one were born, And as to these things one who had become dead,— Like the stars of the heaven､ for multitude, And as the sand that is by the lip of the sea､ that cannot be numbered.

content: 13 In faith all these died— Not bearing away the promises, But from afar beholding and saluting them､ And confessing that strangers and sojourners were they upon the land.
content_old: 13 In faith all these died— Not bearing away the promises, But from afar beholding and saluting them､ And confessing that strangers and sojourners were they upon the land.

content: 14 For they who such things as these are saying Make it clear that of a paternal home they are in quest;
content_old: 14 For they who such things as these are saying Make it clear that of a paternal home they are in quest;

content: 15 And if indeed of that they had been mindful､ from which they had come out They might､ in that case､ have had an opportunity to return;
content_old: 15 And if indeed of that they had been mindful､ from which they had come out They might､ in that case､ have had an opportunity to return;

content: 16 But now after a better one are they reaching, That is､ a heavenly; Wherefore God is not ashamed of them､ to be invoked as their God,— For he hath prepared for them a city.
content_old: 16 But now after a better one are they reaching, That is､ a heavenly; Wherefore God is not ashamed of them､ to be invoked as their God,— For he hath prepared for them a city.

content: 17 By faith Abraham when tested offered up Isaac, And the only-begotten would he have offered up who the promises had accepted ,—
content_old: 17 By faith Abraham when tested offered up Isaac, And the only-begotten would he have offered up who the promises had accepted ,—

content: 18 Even him of whom it had been said— In Isaac shall there be called to thee a seed:
content_old: 18 Even him of whom it had been said— In Isaac shall there be called to thee a seed:

content: 19 Accounting that even from among the dead God was able to raise him,— Whence even in similitude he bare him away.
content_old: 19 Accounting that even from among the dead God was able to raise him,— Whence even in similitude he bare him away.

content: 20 By faith even concerning things to come did Isaac bless Jacob and Esau.
content_old: 20 By faith even concerning things to come did Isaac bless Jacob and Esau.

content: 21 By faith Jacob､ when about to die､ Blessed each of the sons of Joseph; And bowed in worship on the top of his staff.
content_old: 21 By faith Jacob､ when about to die､ Blessed each of the sons of Joseph; And bowed in worship on the top of his staff.

content: 22 By faith Joseph､ when drawing to his end— Concerning the exodus of the sons of Israel called to remembrance, And concerning his bones gave commandment.
content_old: 22 By faith Joseph､ when drawing to his end— Concerning the exodus of the sons of Israel called to remembrance, And concerning his bones gave commandment.

content: 23 By faith Moses､ when born— Was hid three months by his parents, Because they saw that goodly was the child､ And were not affrighted at the decree of the king.
content_old: 23 By faith Moses､ when born— Was hid three months by his parents, Because they saw that goodly was the child､ And were not affrighted at the decree of the king.

content: 24 By faith Moses､ when grown up— Refused to be called the son of a daughter of a Pharaoh,
content_old: 24 By faith Moses､ when grown up— Refused to be called the son of a daughter of a Pharaoh,

content: 25 Rather choosing— To be jointly suffering ill-treatment with the people of God､ Than for a season to be having sin’s enjoyment;
content_old: 25 Rather choosing— To be jointly suffering ill-treatment with the people of God､ Than for a season to be having sin’s enjoyment;

content: 26 Accounting— As greater riches than Egypt’s treasures The reproach of the Anointed One; For he was looking away unto the recompense.
content_old: 26 Accounting— As greater riches than Egypt’s treasures The reproach of the Anointed One; For he was looking away unto the recompense.

content: 27 By faith he forsook Egypt— Not put in fear of the wrath of the king; For as seeing him who cannot he seen he persevered.
content_old: 27 By faith he forsook Egypt— Not put in fear of the wrath of the king; For as seeing him who cannot he seen he persevered.

content: 28 By faith be hath kept the passover and the besmearing of the blood, Lest he that was destroying the first-born should be touching them.
content_old: 28 By faith be hath kept the passover and the besmearing of the blood, Lest he that was destroying the first-born should be touching them.

content: 29 By faith they passed through the Red Sea､ as over dry land,— Which the Egyptians seizing an attempt to do were swallowed up.
content_old: 29 By faith they passed through the Red Sea､ as over dry land,— Which the Egyptians seizing an attempt to do were swallowed up.

content: 30 By faith the walls of Jericho fell, Having been surrounded for seven days.
content_old: 30 By faith the walls of Jericho fell, Having been surrounded for seven days.

content: 31 By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with them who refused to yield, She having welcomed the spies with peace.
content_old: 31 By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with them who refused to yield, She having welcomed the spies with peace.

content: 32 And what more can I say? For time will fail me while I go on telling— Concerning Gideon､ Barak､ Sampson､ Jephthah, David also､ and Samuel､ and the prophets,—
content_old: 32 And what more can I say? For time will fail me while I go on telling— Concerning Gideon､ Barak､ Sampson､ Jephthah, David also､ and Samuel､ and the prophets,—

content: 33 Who through faith— Prevailed in contest over kingdoms､ Wrought righteousness, Attained unto promises､ Shut the mouths of lions,
content_old: 33 Who through faith— Prevailed in contest over kingdoms､ Wrought righteousness, Attained unto promises､ Shut the mouths of lions,

content: 34 Quenched the power of fire､ Escaped the mouths of the sword, Were made powerful from weakness､ Became mighty in battle､ Overturned camps of aliens;
content_old: 34 Quenched the power of fire､ Escaped the mouths of the sword, Were made powerful from weakness､ Became mighty in battle､ Overturned camps of aliens;

content: 35 Women received by resurrection their dead; But others were put to the rack､ Not accepting redemption, That unto a better resurrection they might attain:
content_old: 35 Women received by resurrection their dead; But others were put to the rack､ Not accepting redemption, That unto a better resurrection they might attain:

content: 36 Others again､ of mockings and scourgings received trial, Nay! further of bonds and imprisonments:
content_old: 36 Others again､ of mockings and scourgings received trial, Nay! further of bonds and imprisonments:

content: 37 They were stoned､ were pierced through､ were sawn asunder, By murder､ with a sword､ died, Went about in sheep-skins､ in goat-hides,— Being in want､ suffering tribulation, enduring ill-treatment:
content_old: 37 They were stoned､ were pierced through､ were sawn asunder, By murder､ with a sword､ died, Went about in sheep-skins､ in goat-hides,— Being in want､ suffering tribulation, enduring ill-treatment:

content: 38 Of whom the world was not worthy— Upon deserts wandering､ and mountains, and in caves,—and in the caverns of the earth.
content_old: 38 Of whom the world was not worthy— Upon deserts wandering､ and mountains, and in caves,—and in the caverns of the earth.

content: 39 And these all though they obtained witness through their faith Yet bare not away the promise:
content_old: 39 And these all though they obtained witness through their faith Yet bare not away the promise:

content: 1 Therefore､ indeed､ Seeing that we also have encircling us so great a cloud of witnesses Stripping off every incumbrance and the easily entangling sin With endurance let us be running the race that is lying before us,
content_old: 1 Therefore､ indeed､ Seeing that we also have encircling us so great a cloud of witnesses Stripping off every incumbrance and the easily entangling sin With endurance let us be running the race that is lying before us,

content: 2 Looking away unto our faith’s Princely-leader and perfecter､ Jesus,— Who in consideration of the joy lying before him Endured a cross､ shame despising! And on the right hand of the throne of God hath taken his seat.
content_old: 2 Looking away unto our faith’s Princely-leader and perfecter､ Jesus,— Who in consideration of the joy lying before him Endured a cross､ shame despising! And on the right hand of the throne of God hath taken his seat.

content: 3 For take ye into consideration— Him who hath endured such contradiction by sinners against themselves, Lest ye be wearied､ in your souls becoming exhausted.
content_old: 3 For take ye into consideration— Him who hath endured such contradiction by sinners against themselves, Lest ye be wearied､ in your souls becoming exhausted.

content: 4 Not yet unto blood have ye resisted､ against sin waging a contest;
content_old: 4 Not yet unto blood have ye resisted､ against sin waging a contest;

content: 5 And ye have quite forgotten the exhortation which､ indeed､ with you as with sons doth reason:— My son! be not slighting the discipline of the Lord, Neither be fainting､ when by him thou art reproved;
content_old: 5 And ye have quite forgotten the exhortation which､ indeed､ with you as with sons doth reason:— My son! be not slighting the discipline of the Lord, Neither be fainting､ when by him thou art reproved;

content: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he doth discipline, And scourgeth every son whom he doth welcome home.
content_old: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he doth discipline, And scourgeth every son whom he doth welcome home.

content: 7 For the sake of discipline persevere! As towards sons God beareth himself towards you; For who is a son whom a father doth not discipline?
content_old: 7 For the sake of discipline persevere! As towards sons God beareth himself towards you; For who is a son whom a father doth not discipline?

content: 8 If however ye are without discipline､ Whereof all have received a share Then are ye bastards and not sons.
content_old: 8 If however ye are without discipline､ Whereof all have received a share Then are ye bastards and not sons.

content: 9 Furthermore､ indeed the fathers of our flesh we used to have､ as administrators of discipline, And we used to pay deference: Shall we not much rather submit ourselves to the Father of our spirits and live?
content_old: 9 Furthermore､ indeed the fathers of our flesh we used to have､ as administrators of discipline, And we used to pay deference: Shall we not much rather submit ourselves to the Father of our spirits and live?

content: 10 For they indeed､ for a few days, according to that which seemed good to them were administering discipline; But he unto that which is profitable､ with a view to our partaking of his holiness:
content_old: 10 For they indeed､ for a few days, according to that which seemed good to them were administering discipline; But he unto that which is profitable､ with a view to our partaking of his holiness:

content: 11 But no discipline for the present､ indeed seemeth to be of joy､ but of sorrow: Afterwards however— To them who thereby have been well trained It yieldeth peaceful fruit of righteousness.
content_old: 11 But no discipline for the present､ indeed seemeth to be of joy､ but of sorrow: Afterwards however— To them who thereby have been well trained It yieldeth peaceful fruit of righteousness.

content: 12 Wherefore the slackened hands and paralysed knees restore ye,
content_old: 12 Wherefore the slackened hands and paralysed knees restore ye,

content: 13 And straight tracks be making for your feet— That the lame member may not be dislocated､ but be healed rather.
content_old: 13 And straight tracks be making for your feet— That the lame member may not be dislocated､ but be healed rather.

content: 14 Peace be pursuing､ with all, and the obtaining of holiness,— Without which no one shall see the Lord:
content_old: 14 Peace be pursuing､ with all, and the obtaining of holiness,— Without which no one shall see the Lord:

content: 15 Using oversight— Lest any one be falling behind from the favour of God,— Lest any root of bitterness springing up above be causing trouble, And through it the many be defiled:
content_old: 15 Using oversight— Lest any one be falling behind from the favour of God,— Lest any root of bitterness springing up above be causing trouble, And through it the many be defiled:

content: 16 Lest there be any fornicator, or profane person like Esau,— Who for the sake of one meal yielded up his own firstborn rights;
content_old: 16 Lest there be any fornicator, or profane person like Esau,— Who for the sake of one meal yielded up his own firstborn rights;

content: 17 For ye know that afterwards— When he even wished to inherit the blessing He was rejected; For place of repentance|found he none, Even though with tears he diligently sought it.
content_old: 17 For ye know that afterwards— When he even wished to inherit the blessing He was rejected; For place of repentance|found he none, Even though with tears he diligently sought it.

content: 18 For ye have not approached— Unto a searching and scorching fire, And gloom､ and mist､ and tempest,
content_old: 18 For ye have not approached— Unto a searching and scorching fire, And gloom､ and mist､ and tempest,

content: 19 And a trumpet’s peal,— And a sound of things spoken:— From which they who heard excused themselves, Lest there should be added to them a word;
content_old: 19 And a trumpet’s peal,— And a sound of things spoken:— From which they who heard excused themselves, Lest there should be added to them a word;

content: 20 For they could not bear that which was being enjoined,— And should a beast be touching the mountain it shall be stoned;
content_old: 20 For they could not bear that which was being enjoined,— And should a beast be touching the mountain it shall be stoned;

content: 21 And so fearful was that which was showing itself Moses said— I am terrified､ and do tremble!
content_old: 21 And so fearful was that which was showing itself Moses said— I am terrified､ and do tremble!

content: 22 But ye have approached— Unto Zion’s mountain, And unto the city of a Living God､ a heavenly Jerusalem,— And unto myriads of messengers
content_old: 22 But ye have approached— Unto Zion’s mountain, And unto the city of a Living God､ a heavenly Jerusalem,— And unto myriads of messengers

content: 23 in high festival,— And unto an assembly of firstborn ones､ enrolled in the heavens,— And unto God judge of all,— And unto the spirits of righteous ones made perfect,—
content_old: 23 in high festival,— And unto an assembly of firstborn ones､ enrolled in the heavens,— And unto God judge of all,— And unto the spirits of righteous ones made perfect,—

content: 24 And unto the mediator of a new covenant､ Jesus,— And unto the blood of sprinkling､ more excellently speaking than Abel.
content_old: 24 And unto the mediator of a new covenant､ Jesus,— And unto the blood of sprinkling､ more excellently speaking than Abel.

content: 25 Beware､ lest ye excuse yourselves from him that speaketh; For if they escaped not､ who excused themselves from him who on earth was warning How much less shall we who from him that warneth from the heavens do turn ourselves away:
content_old: 25 Beware､ lest ye excuse yourselves from him that speaketh; For if they escaped not､ who excused themselves from him who on earth was warning How much less shall we who from him that warneth from the heavens do turn ourselves away:

content: 26 Whose voice shook the earth then, But now hath he promised､ saying— Yet once for all I will shake— Not only the earth But also the heaven.
content_old: 26 Whose voice shook the earth then, But now hath he promised､ saying— Yet once for all I will shake— Not only the earth But also the heaven.

content: 27 But the saying Yet once for all Maketh clear the removal of the things which can be shaken, As of things done with,— That they may remain which cannot be shaken.
content_old: 27 But the saying Yet once for all Maketh clear the removal of the things which can be shaken, As of things done with,— That they may remain which cannot be shaken.

content: 28 Wherefore Seeing that of a kingdom not to be shaken we are receiving possession Let us have gratitude— Whereby we may be rendering divine service well-pleasingly unto God､ with reverence and awe;
content_old: 28 Wherefore Seeing that of a kingdom not to be shaken we are receiving possession Let us have gratitude— Whereby we may be rendering divine service well-pleasingly unto God､ with reverence and awe;
